Community Resource Link

Get help finding food, jobs, housing, or other things you may need.

More support from your community

  • National Domestic Violence Hotline — Call 1-800-799-7233.
  • Indiana Poision Center — Call 1-800-222-1222.
  • Indiana 2-1-1 — A free, 24-hour service, connectiong you to food, shelter and housing assistance, employment services, counseling services and much more. Call 2-1-1.
  • Gateway to Work — A free, optional program to help you build the skills you need to get new or better jobs.
  • Indiana Tobocco Outline — A free support line to help you break the smoking habit. Call 1-800-QUIT-NOW (1-800-784-8669). Or select Click to Call on the Quitline homepage to have a specialist call you.
  • About Special Kids — Indiana's parent-to-parent organization, offering advice and resources to families of children with special needs. Call 1-800-964-4746.
  • Autism Resource Network of Indiana — Call 1-800-609-8449.
  • Autism Society of Indiana — Call 1-800-609-8449.
  • National Poision Control Center — Get free poision prevention advice and treatment. Call 1-800-222-1222.
  • Relay Indiana — Call 1-800-743-3333 (TTY 711) if you have hearing or speech loss and a trained person will help you talk to someone who uses a standard phone.
  • Women, Infants, amd Children (WIC) program — Offers healthy food to pregnant women and mothers of young children. Call 1-800-522-0874.

Visit the community at Online Peer Support today. And start to feel better.

Online Peer Support

Benefit options

  • Healthy Indiana Plan for low-income adults
  • Hoosier Healthwise for children and pregnant women
  • Hoosier Care Connect for those who are aged, blind, or with a disability
  • Tools to help you manage your condition

Member tools

  • Health needs screening: Get your $10 gift card
  • Renew your benefits
